page.title: 14MILVERTON LIBRARY
page.content:
IN MILVERTON THE LIBRARY VAN COMES EVERY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND PARKS BY THE SCHOOL GATE. ON HIS WAY TO MILVERTON HE GOES TO WIVELISCOME AND WELLINGTON. THE VAN GOES TWENTY MILES IN A DAY, SO IN FIVE DAYS, THE VAN WOULD TRAVEL A HUNDRED MILES. THE LIBRARY VAN HAS ONLY BROKEN DOWN ONCE.
YOU DO NOT HAVE TO PAY TO BORROW BOOKS FROM THE LIBRARY VAN. IN MILVERTON, ABOUT TEN PEOPLE USE IT EVERY DAY. IT GETS NEW BOOKS EVERY SIX WEEKS. PEOPLE ARE ONLY ALLOWED TO BORROW THREE BOOKS EVERY WEEK. SO FAR NO ONE HAS EVER STOLEN A BOOK. WHEN THE BOOKS GET TATTY THE LIBRARIAN SELLS THEM TO A JUMBLE SALE TO RAISE MONEY FOR NEW BOOKS. HE ENJOYS HIS JOB VERY MUCH.
